issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/184282

pull_request.title: Bump husky from 9.1.6 to 9.1.7
pull_request.body:
Bumps [husky](https://github.com/typicode/husky) from 9.1.6 to 9.1.7.
Release notes

Sourced from husky's releases.

v9.1.7

What's Changed

  • fix: add husky label to deprecated warning by @‚Äãsmackfu in typicode/husky#1538

New Contributors

  • @‚Äãsmackfu made their first contribution in typicode/husky#1538

Full Changelog: https://github.com/typicode/husky/compare/v9.1.6...v9.1.7

Commits
  • 799e84b 9.1.7
  • 30f2049 fix: add husky label to deprecated warning (#1538)
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=husky&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=9.1.6&new-version=9.1.7)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

comment.body:
@repor754 Thanks for checking. Could you please send screenshots of the filtering log from AdGuard, while try to play the video.
You need to:
1. switch on AdGuard and open filtering log (AdGuard icon in the top menu --> gear --> advanced --> filtering log).
2. go to the page where the error occurs
3. start playing the video
4. get an error
5. take a screenshot of all requests from this page and attach the screenshot to a GitHub comment.

comment.body:
@lassekongo83 Could you please take a look?
The problem occurs only in mobile view and it's caused by this part `.externalBottomMobile` from this rule:
```adblock
swedroid.se##div[id$="_ad"], div[id$="_ad_mobile"], .externalTopMobile, #externalTopMobile, .externalBottomMobile, a[href^="//www.prisjakt.nu/produkt"], #nativendo-mainfeed + aside > .article, .article-footer > h3, .article-footer > .aeChart, #newExternal
```

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Website or app doesn't work properly, Annoyances ‚Äî pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.iltalehti.fi/kamppailulajit/a/7a1723da-2275-48b3-b92c-ee8e6f640f29

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, EasyList

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

AdGuard Cookie Notices filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Iltalehti.fi on recent days changed their cookie prompt and now when using the list `AdGuard ‚Äì Cookie Notices` on uBlock, the cookie prompt gets blocked by the rule `||cdn.privacy-mgmt.com^$3p` and the updated `trusted-set-cookie` rule in `uBlock filters ‚Äì Cookie Notices` fails to work causing for example video to not play.

Rule like this makes it work again
`@@||cdn.privacy-mgmt.com/unified/wrapperMessagingWithoutDetection.js$script,domain=iltalehti.fi`

Sample link with video
https://www.iltalehti.fi/kamppailulajit/a/7a1723da-2275-48b3-b92c-ee8e6f640f29

Screenshots / Video not playing
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0000dbec-5909-4ddd-891d-3f8c1bf13d7f)

Video playing with the exception rule
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f25dba1a-a3d0-4e44-8838-c98b489cbade)


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: I see they include self-links to `danseisama.com` so according to https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/92371#issuecomment-906601164 we won't block them. However, though I don't know how exactly it works, it looks most of the links are outer ones and it just happened to include self-link by algorythm as the site is popular. I tend to think we can block blogroll in such cases, or possibly unless all links are self-links. What do you think @Sergey-Lyapin @Alex-302 ? Of note they can be blocked with `||danseisama.com/js/*link.js`

issue.title: Get rid of JS rules against window.open
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

We need to replace JS rules by scriptlets when it is possible.

### Proposed solution

The JS rules with `window.open_` / `window.open =` / `window.open=` must be remove or converted to the scriptlet syntax, if a rule still required.

### Additional information

_No response_

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/184282

issue.title: Could fake unsubscribe websites be blocked (given they exist purely for phishing)?
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

I use AdGuard Public DNS, using the default option which blocks ads, trackers and malware domains.

This URL inside web-browsers:
https://dns.adguard-dns.com/dns-query

And this one for the system-wide DNS on Android devices:
tls://dns.adguard-dns.com

I notice that the default filters the public DNS option uses never seem to block any of those websites
that are fake e-mail unsubscribe pages, that exist purely to harvest working e-mail addresses.

### Proposed solution

Given fake e-mail unsubscribe websites exist purely to collect working e-mail addresses to then send
more spam to, surely they should be classed as "phishing" and blocked by AdGuard DNS (and the
browser extensions also)?

The e-mail that are sent usually either lead to other phishing or scam sites, or malware pages.

### Additional information

Here are some example sites I feel AdGuard DNS should be blocking:

![allinoursite_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b87ffd07-9564-4784-8af3-3659b3db2a7c)

![doorsstormsy_shop](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1fa56ae3-22f4-49c7-9878-bff8ad32d31c)

![emailservicesnetau_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/53f8e566-f590-4e53-9ad9-341abeb1faf1)

![euromaillinnk_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/64c6dddf-812b-4904-9ba0-4bb1584b1e4c)

![findthorman_shop](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e1196ea5-8fa9-4ddf-9fba-023fe24cb424)

![keydoordasher_shop](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/956c789d-c04e-413f-9970-3dd7022d7679)

![mybach_xyz](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/853ea44f-661b-4107-9378-5ddee433f18d)

![threeneptuneboot_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2e39b662-2b4a-4b65-99b1-3a586da38772)


I do not see any-benefit to end-users of allowing access to these sites, when they're only used to gather e-mail
addresses to then send them more spam by e-mail!

Thanks

comment.body: (Oh and before any points out: yes, I am using _uBlock Origin Lite_ in _Microsoft Edge_ , not _AdGuard_ .  But I have used their browser-extension previously, and it never used to block such-sites then.  But regardless: I feel the AdGuard DNS service should do this, given all of these domains seem to exist solely to collect e-mail addresses and I doubt have any actual "good" pages hosted on them.  If you delete everything after the domain, and load their pages, you usually get a "website coming soon" landing-page, so I'd say the entire domain can just be blocked.)

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/184282

issue.title: Could fake unsubscribe websites be blocked (given they exist purely for phishing)?
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

I use AdGuard Public DNS, using the default option which blocks ads, trackers and malware domains.

This URL inside web-browsers:
https://dns.adguard-dns.com/dns-query

And this one for the system-wide DNS on Android devices:
tls://dns.adguard-dns.com

I notice that the default filters the public DNS option uses never seem to block any of those websites
that are fake e-mail unsubscribe pages, that exist purely to harvest working e-mail addresses.

### Proposed solution

Given fake e-mail unsubscribe websites exist purely to collect working e-mail addresses to then send
more spam to, surely they should be classed as "phishing" and blocked by AdGuard DNS (and the
browser extensions also)?

The e-mail that are sent usually either lead to other phishing or scam sites, or malware pages.

### Additional information

Here are some example sites I feel AdGuard DNS should be blocking:

![allinoursite_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b87ffd07-9564-4784-8af3-3659b3db2a7c)

![doorsstormsy_shop](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1fa56ae3-22f4-49c7-9878-bff8ad32d31c)

![emailservicesnetau_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/53f8e566-f590-4e53-9ad9-341abeb1faf1)

![euromaillinnk_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/64c6dddf-812b-4904-9ba0-4bb1584b1e4c)

![findthorman_shop](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e1196ea5-8fa9-4ddf-9fba-023fe24cb424)

![keydoordasher_shop](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/956c789d-c04e-413f-9970-3dd7022d7679)

![mybach_xyz](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/853ea44f-661b-4107-9378-5ddee433f18d)

![threeneptuneboot_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2e39b662-2b4a-4b65-99b1-3a586da38772)


I do not see any-benefit to end-users of allowing access to these sites, when they're only used to gather e-mail
addresses to then send them more spam by e-mail!

Thanks

issue.title: Could fake unsubscribe websites be blocked (given they exist purely for phishing)?
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

I use AdGuard Public DNS, using the default option which blocks ads, trackers and malware domains.

This URL inside web-browsers:
https://dns.adguard-dns.com/dns-query

And this one for the system-wide DNS on Android devices:
tls://dns.adguard-dns.com

I notice that the default filters the public DNS option uses never seem to block any of those websites
that are fake e-mail unsubscribe pages, that exist purely to harvest working e-mail addresses.

### Proposed solution

Given fake e-mail unsubscribe websites exist purely to collect working e-mail addresses to then send
more spam to, surely they should be classed as "phishing" and blocked by AdGuard DNS (and the
browser extensions also)?

The e-mail that are sent usually either lead to other phishing or scam sites, or malware pages.

### Additional information

Here are some example sites I feel AdGuard DNS should be blocking:

![allinoursite_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b87ffd07-9564-4784-8af3-3659b3db2a7c)

![doorsstormsy_shop](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1fa56ae3-22f4-49c7-9878-bff8ad32d31c)

![emailservicesnetau_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/53f8e566-f590-4e53-9ad9-341abeb1faf1)

![euromaillinnk_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/64c6dddf-812b-4904-9ba0-4bb1584b1e4c)

![findthorman_shop](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e1196ea5-8fa9-4ddf-9fba-023fe24cb424)

![keydoordasher_shop](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/956c789d-c04e-413f-9970-3dd7022d7679)

![mybach_xyz](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/853ea44f-661b-4107-9378-5ddee433f18d)

![threeneptuneboot_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2e39b662-2b4a-4b65-99b1-3a586da38772)


I do not see any-benefit to end-users of allowing access to these sites, when they're only used to gather e-mail
addresses to then send them more spam by e-mail!

Thanks

comment.body: Moved to https://github.com/hagezi/dns-blocklists/issues/4376

issue.title: Could fake unsubscribe websites be blocked (given they exist purely for phishing)?
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

I use AdGuard Public DNS, using the default option which blocks ads, trackers and malware domains.

This URL inside web-browsers:
https://dns.adguard-dns.com/dns-query

And this one for the system-wide DNS on Android devices:
tls://dns.adguard-dns.com

I notice that the default filters the public DNS option uses never seem to block any of those websites
that are fake e-mail unsubscribe pages, that exist purely to harvest working e-mail addresses.

### Proposed solution

Given fake e-mail unsubscribe websites exist purely to collect working e-mail addresses to then send
more spam to, surely they should be classed as "phishing" and blocked by AdGuard DNS (and the
browser extensions also)?

The e-mail that are sent usually either lead to other phishing or scam sites, or malware pages.

### Additional information

Here are some example sites I feel AdGuard DNS should be blocking:

![allinoursite_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b87ffd07-9564-4784-8af3-3659b3db2a7c)

![doorsstormsy_shop](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1fa56ae3-22f4-49c7-9878-bff8ad32d31c)

![emailservicesnetau_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/53f8e566-f590-4e53-9ad9-341abeb1faf1)

![euromaillinnk_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/64c6dddf-812b-4904-9ba0-4bb1584b1e4c)

![findthorman_shop](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e1196ea5-8fa9-4ddf-9fba-023fe24cb424)

![keydoordasher_shop](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/956c789d-c04e-413f-9970-3dd7022d7679)

![mybach_xyz](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/853ea44f-661b-4107-9378-5ddee433f18d)

![threeneptuneboot_com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2e39b662-2b4a-4b65-99b1-3a586da38772)


I do not see any-benefit to end-users of allowing access to these sites, when they're only used to gather e-mail
addresses to then send them more spam by e-mail!

Thanks

comment.body: i suggest you subscribe to hagezi list i have posted them there

comment.body:
Hi @jordansworld : sure, but posting the entire URLs wouldn't be helpful, as these are randomised
on each e-mail so they can track who clicked them

Really it is the entire _domains_ that need to be blocked, as from what I can tell, they exist only to
serve that one fake unsubscribe page.  If you visit any these sites (none of which use HTTPS, so you'll
have to accept dropping-onto HTTP), you'll either see a "website coming soon" message, or some Linux
server message saying "how to configure your server".

List of domains:
allinoursite.com
doorsstormsy.shop
emailservicesnetau.com
euromaillinnk.com
findthorman.shop
keydoordasher.shop
mybach.xyz
threeneptuneboot.com

Thanks
